document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades 3-5

F6650B9FCD3448CC9E44802502E457A5.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade
appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those
that signal contrast, addition, and other logical
relationships (e.g., however, although,
nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

7CF60FF97E5B45B8A7D476B95E307614.description:
Use the relationship between
particular words (e.g., synonyms,
antonyms, homographs) to better
understand each of the words.

FCC22B9F46DA4FC7AEFF80B6DFBF6136.description:
Recognize and explain the meaning
of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

3052250341944012BFCD81C539881849.description:
Interpret figurative language,
including similes and metaphors, in
context.

8A1332C8C97842A6BAB8C9EA4F51B592.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative
language, word relationships, and nuances in
word meanings.

3656722520764FD9B135FA3CB6E6A7B9.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g.,
dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both
print and digital, to find the pronunciation
and determine or clarify the precise
meaning of key words and phrases.

8EC15E46C96141E2B06A88C42C9EF12A.description:
Use common, grade appropriate
Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues
to the meaning of a word (e.g.,
photograph, photosynthesis).

9A9969EE06504C8CBC1B0C1E42A20C19.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect
relationships and comparisons in text) as a
clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

09038001E73047EEA11E0F2016146176.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 5 reading and content,
choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. 

65A8B8F57E6B44B4AF8A0DE89F0F3D77.description:
Compare and contrast the varieties
of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in
stories, dramas, or poems.

7E5390F1D93F4B998D5D91EE1CF46571.description:
Expand, combine, and reduce
sentences for meaning, reader/listener
interest, and style.

BCDDCCCD566D42758571F70166999115.description:
Use knowledge of language and its
conventions when writing, speaking, reading,
or listening.

B7B2BA55ED724348B5268A7F522B727A.description:
Spell grade-appropriate words
correctly, consulting references as needed.

DE3882EF22344F558E37AD41E50B9932.description:
Use underlining, quotation marks,
or italics to indicate titles of works.

0380A702DF344818BCCAAED57E7A5319.description:
Use a comma to set off the words
yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off
a tag question from the rest of the
sentence (e.g., It's true, isn't it?), and to
indicate direct address (e.g., Is that you,
Steve?).

69BE2AE002BE4AA58E504DD9EE4A73AB.description:
Use a comma to separate an
introductory element from the rest of the
sentence.

131D689C48C34E22BB818886970C06B3.description:
Use punctuation to separate items
in a series. *

1E5B8DEA15374A7698A53833972FB09C.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

C675AA156B174BE2A8E1ABE4737B451E.description:
Recognize and correct
inappropriate shifts in verb tense. *

435DC71AF3CE45A1A0D87E1E29C8B7BE.description:
Use verb tense to convey various
times, sequences, states, and conditions.

B42716956010431D8CBF7ECDD994E575.description:
Form and use the perfect (e.g., I
had walked; I have walked; I will have
walked) verb tenses.

DB086E01065F4F788A7C9FDDD1C7C813.description:
Explain the function of
conjunctions, prepositions, and
interjections in general and their function
in particular sentences.

8CD34CA9BA074DECA29B54AE8E1760A6.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English grammar and
usage when writing or speaking.

E999F8DDF34B4217B172734987688502.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts
and tasks, using formal English when
appropriate to task and situation (See grade 5
Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations.)

1F4A72C8FCE147D8A41524099EE8B076.description:
Include multimedia components(e.g.,
graphics, sound) and visual displays in
presentations when appropriate to enhance
the development of main ideas or themes.

17331CDEE5DD4FB6B555BA9EF8C1D3E2.description:
Report on a topic or text or present an
opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using
appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive
details to support main ideas or themes; speak
clearly at an understandable pace.

31583A61CA034FF8A10219E7E8CF6169.description:
Summarize the points a speaker makes
and explain how each claim is supported by
reasons and evidence.

395F0999DF3646419F0A5D50398935F9.description:
Summarize a written text read aloud or
information presented in diverse media and
formats, including visually, quantitatively, and
orally.

F57A938589B842CD94065553AECDFBAB.description:
Review the key ideas expressed
and draw conclusions in light of
information and knowledge gained from
the discussions.

9D1EDD2BAFB0408C8A7D59096B492BFD.description:
Pose and respond to specific
questions by making comments that
contribute to the discussion and elaborate
on the remarks of others.

21292B5910CF4722B103CAEA489EF1CD.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for
discussions and carry out assigned roles.

A347A76E60004994B9D9AE21E960D254.description:
Come to discussions prepared,
having read or studied required material;
explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic
to explore ideas under discussion.

4612717A3A01445084EB47DE4A66FD98.description:
Engage effectively in a range of
collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in
groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners
on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others'
ideas and expressing their own clearly.

FEE814D870B44AE184A414033F5CDF24.description:
Write routinely over extended time
frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single
sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

AC40893847464933BD8818A2F86C3399.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards
to informational texts(e.g., "Explain how
an author uses reasons and evidence to
support particular points in a text,
identifying which reasons and evidence
support which point[s]"").

2F9FB48A2F4E451685D395DC8118AD9A.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards
to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast
two or more characters, settings, or events
in a story or a drama, drawing on specific
details in the text [e.g., how characters
interact]").

9404AE691D534F18AC3160E0943F278D.description:
Draw evidence from literary or
informational texts to support analysis,
reflection, and research.

732FEEB5A69D4049BB595BB1AB5C769B.description:
Recall relevant information from
experiences or gather relevant information
from print and digital sources; summarize or
paraphrase information in notes and finished
work, and provide a list of sources.

91C968A5C8854BD3BBB128870A284DA2.description:
Conduct short research projects that use
several sources to build knowledge through
investigation of different aspects of a topic.

33D1D9A056074DAA8C3A08461016D78D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

027554ED5AD14479B2FEF7CCFACB3530.description:
With some guidance and support from
adults, use technology, including the Internet,
to produce and publish writing as well as to
interact and collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient command of
keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two
pages in a single sitting.

44C3E679E2EA4BAD9A8CDD8437E1ABE9.description:
With guidance and support from peers
and adults, develop and strengthen writing as
needed by planning, revising, editing,
rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing
for conventions should demonstrate command
of Language standards 1-3 up to and including
grade 5.)

53ED396DE15D402BAD6A60A6BBF93021.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in
which the development and organization are
appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
(Grade-specific expectations for writing types
are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

C58F2A304A8942E4BB3F4C25F0EEB4C4.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows
from the narrated experiences or events.

D38B6D7505BF49ADAC43017A1802DE18.description:
Use concrete words and phrases
and sensory details to convey experiences
and events precisely.

A534EFF6655D4588BAF295719F71AEBB.description:
Use a variety of transitional
words, phrases, and clauses to manage the
sequence of events.

6BC3E3479F584F978B47F0FA2F8286E4.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as
dialogue, description, and pacing, to
develop experiences and events or show
the responses of characters to situations.

51E098A8DBC34F06BA57AD52EC149604.description:
Orient the reader by establishing
a situation and introducing a narrator
and/or characters; organize an event
sequence that unfolds naturally.

4ACCD2D1B0AC4048AE3ED05D04B0F808.description:
Write narratives to develop real or
imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, descriptive details, and clear event
sequences.

0158E1622F484C999257482B6EDB7494.description:
Provide a concluding statement or
section related to the information or
explanation presented.

2612125438014507AB2286769A63D674.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or
explain the topic.

799FCC1D53C24F719270EBDECA5B04BA.description:
Link ideas within and across
categories of information using words,
phrases, and clauses (e.g., in contrast,
especially).

F58ACF4A691B4B4F9312727405F1B0CA.description:
Develop the topic with facts,
definitions, concrete details, quotations,
or other information and examples related
to the topic.

E660CA6313DD420F912C862D974606D0.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, provide
a general observation and focus, and
group related information logically;
include formatting (e.g., headings),
illustrations, and multimedia when useful
to aiding comprehension.

8B2BBC2EED98474BA443A3E90A3D865A.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to
examine a topic and convey ideas and
information clearly.

12DCA96CBE5043979C783BF7BEA14438.description:
Provide a concluding statement or
section related to the opinion presented.

F0D08E7A7A1C469086017894D3513B87.description:
Link opinion and reasons using
words, phrases, and clauses (e.g.,
consequently, specifically).

9401E958F20045F48808377A9341B51B.description:
Provide logically ordered reasons
that are supported by facts and details.

9A3C839B443B43EA8EF5FC1FE1F7DA89.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly,
state an opinion, and create an
organizational structure in which ideas are
logically grouped to support the writer's
purpose.

5826424363274956953553D2BEF9337F.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts,
supporting a point of view with reasons and
information.

18E7869936FF471283C985D8B0B791A5.description:
Use context to confirm or self correct word recognition and
understanding, rereading as necessary.

614E7633EAA24A1E829C33317EE0830F.description:
Read grade-level prose and
poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on successive
readings.

D0D931322F19416F9E23C70221C2514F.description:
Read grade-level text with
purpose and understanding.

FF3AF0CDDD6B4D86B8C1DE58DF13F437.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

47D4A36F11CB4D03AD04A4F50E54F382.description:
Use combined knowledge of all
letter-sound correspondences,
syllabication patterns, and morphology
(e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately
unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context
and out of context.

3B79F590DC6C4600B00A671E88938858.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word
analysis skills in decoding words.

A1495261C3F643DD9ED0AFFDF7EDEE6A.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend informational texts, including
history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text
complexity band independently and
proficiently.

D0A993AF7B7E43B0B0E36966BFA89816.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

119B1D2FEDA44D30AC8D9742788F8516.description:
Integrate information from several texts
on the same topic in order to write or speak
about the subject knowledgeably.

207DE47BF1774939BF484C5107C4644F.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and
evidence to support particular points in a text,
identifying which reasons and evidence
support which point(s).

609D0C07CF1C47159877145FA0CDF3B5.description:
Draw on information from multiple print
or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to
locate an answer to a question quickly or to
solve a problem efficiently.

EC431D6C2EF0484091CB42118C4FC62E.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same
event or topic, noting important similarities
and differences in the point of view they
represent.

7AB98AC2C6264F06B01B01B1F277B1B0.description:
Compare and contrast the overall
structure (e.g., chronology, comparison,
cause/effect, problem/solution) of events,
ideas, concepts, or information in two or more
texts.

D21C6FFB541549DD94DC8D23B1DA2BD9.description:
Determine the meaning of general
academic and domain-specific words and
phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or
subject area.

41BD8C3750474DC891365305873FDB49.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions
between two or more individuals, events,
ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or
technical text based on specific information in
the text.

1C0B6015E78E4C8E9A4FF80A7907B0D3.description:
Determine two or more main ideas of a
text and explain how they are supported by
key details; summarize the text.

6A4DA8CE30784595AB0E1B64268C562D.description:
Quote accurately from a text when
explaining what the text says explicitly and
when drawing inferences from the text.

45EC80D6B2DA4C71A1DBAF362DCB6949.description:
By the end of the year, read and
comprehend literature, including stories,
dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the
grades 4-5 text complexity band independently
and proficiently.

222BB33D062F40FA8852F9CDE8D0470B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

0906D4E2790C4DA9AA094BAA47BEFAB4.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the
same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure
stories) on their approaches to similar themes
and topics.

4146BFF734A5407EBC065868791B00DF.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia
elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or
beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel,
multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale,
myth, poem).

E8407C62973B45AC92DB6F1302D44B49.description:
Describe how a narrator's or speaker's
point of view influences how events are
described.

DD1637D98AE54A88BC1F3CB740261CFB.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes,
or stanzas fits together to provide the overall
structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

80761EED9CCA4A9FA228EBF881523249.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative language such as metaphors and
similes.

9062748BA9BE41C4B07EDEB11CA7EB7A.description:
Compare and contrast two or more
characters, settings, or events in a story or
drama, drawing on specific details in the text
(e.g., how characters interact).

50A36B842D12423CA250BD06EC53A470.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or
poem from details in the text, including how
characters in a story or drama respond to
challenges or how the speaker in a poem
reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

222E16C6D89F494993A3741A6300C84F.description:
Quote accurately from a text when
explaining what the text says explicitly and
when drawing inferences from the text.
